title: Program Detail - Find a Program
raw_text:
This website uses resources that are being blocked by your network. Contact your network administrator for more information.
Skip to main content
Find a Program
Program Detail
Accounting - Milgard School of Business (Tacoma) - MSAcc 18-month Program
Apply Now >>
Basic Information
Degree Information
Degree Offered:
MASTER OF SCIENCE IN ACCOUNTING
CIP Code:
52.1399
Campus: Tacoma
Admission Requirements and Contact Information
July 1: international students planning to apply for a new student visa (F-1/J-1)
August 1: Final application deadline for domestic applicants (US citizens or permanent residents with green cards) and international applicants who currently have an H1-B, H4, or other visa (including transferring an I-20 from another school)
Contact Information
Clifton Hummel-Young
Program Website
+1 253-692-5776
uwtmsacc@uw.edu
Requirements and Prerequisites
The 18-month MSAcc, (a STEM program) is designed for candidates who currently do not have an academic background in accounting.
18-Month MSAcc Program Requirements
Hold a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university in the U.S. or its equivalent from a foreign institution. A minimum 3.0 grade-point-average on a 4-point scale (or equivalent measures of performance if you are a graduate of an institution with no grading system) for those credits earned at the institution awarding the bachelor’s degree OR at least a 3.0 grade-point-average (on a 4-point scale) for the last 90 graded quarter credits or 60 graded semester credits. For more information, please refer to
Policy 3.1 Graduate Admissions
.
18-Month MSAcc Prerequisite Courses
Minimum 8 credit hours with at least one course in each of the following: Financial Accounting and Managerial Accounting. Must have a B (3.0 on a 4-point scale) or better in each of these courses. Equivalent UW Tacoma courses would be T ACCT 210, 220, 230. The 18-Month program only offers admission to new students in Autumn quarter.
GRE Requirements
GRE Requirement:
Other
. See details below
More Information:  Official GRE scores maybe considered if an applicant is not able to submit GMAT scores or does not qualify for a GMAT waiver. See program website for GMAT waiver information..
Additional Instructions
Admission is based on a number of criteria including:
Satisfactory completion of accounting prerequisite classes
Scores from the GMAT (or qualification for a waiver)
Well-written admission essay
Volunteer and student activities. Work experience is desired but not required for admission.
In selecting the entering class, the Milgard School also strives to create an environment that fosters a rich and satisfying learning experience and is representative of society as a whole.
Non-Native English Speaker Information
Graduate School requirement:
English language proficiency (ELP) is required for graduate study at the University of Washington. Therefore, every applicant whose native language is not English must demonstrate English language proficiency as outlined in
Graduate School Policy 3.2
.
International Student Information
Applicants who will need a visa should reference the
International Applicant Information page
. If admitted to the program, international students requesting an F-1 or J-1 visa will be required to provide
financial ability documentation
to the UW Graduate School.
Program Deadlines
Autumn 2026 - Domestic:
Open Date:
11/15/2025
Deadline Date:
Autumn 2026 - International:
Open Date:
11/15/2025
Deadline Date:
Winter 2027 - Domestic:
Open Date:
01/01/2026
Deadline Date:
Winter 2027 - International:
Open Date:
01/01/2026
Deadline Date:
Application Materials
Personal Statement
Resume
Additional Materials
Required Official Test Score: Executive Assessment
GMAT
GRE
Menu

extracted_fields.application_requirements: Hold a baccalaureate degree from a regionally accredited college or university in the U.S. or its equivalent from a foreign institution. A minimum 3.0 grade-point-average on a 4-point scale for those credits earned at the institution awarding the bachelor’s degree OR at least a 3.0 grade-point-average for the last 90 graded quarter credits or 60 graded semester credits. Minimum 8 credit hours with at least one course in Financial Accounting and Managerial Accounting with a B (3.0 on a 4-point scale) or better. GRE or GMAT scores required unless waived.
extracted_fields.features: The 18-month MSAcc is a STEM program designed for candidates without an academic background in accounting. Admission is based on criteria including prerequisite classes, GMAT scores, admission essay, volunteer and student activities. Work experience is desired but not required.
